title: formal change process for library and language
body:
by **per.arneng**: 
To be able to have a "standard" library that is easy to use and consistent
in its look&feel i think it is important that there is some kind of process
similar to Python's PEP's or Java's JCP.  If you for example look at the
python library it is in some places very inconsistent in coding standards
and behavior. A good "standard" library is the recipe for success of a
language. If this process also covers the language is another question but
that would probably be a good idea.

http://jcp.org/en/home/index
http://www.python.org/dev/peps
